official-title.#text:
To require the Federal Housing Finance Agency to establish a 6-month moratorium on foreclosure of
			 mortgages guaranteed by Fannie Mae or Freddie Mac on homes of individuals
			 who have lost Federal unemployment insurance as a result of the expiration
			 of such program, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#text: Ms. Eddie Bernice Johnson of Texas

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prohibit mortgagees of eligible mortgages
			 under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from initiating a foreclosure, whether judicial or
			 nonjudicial, or taking any action in furtherance of a foreclosure already
			 initiated, including any foreclosure sale, with respect to any eligible
			 mortgage during the foreclosure moratorium period under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c
Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014/s:2/ss:d

text.#text: The

header.#text: Treatment of mortgage payments due during foreclosure moratorium period
Deferral of mortgage payments; interest due

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide that, during the foreclosure moratorium period with respect to an
			 eligible mortgage—

text.#text: The
the term of the mortgage shall toll;
any payments of principal and interest due under the mortgage shall be deferred; and

interest on outstanding principal due under the mortgage shall continue to accrue at the rate
			 provided for under the mortgage.

header.#text: Resumption of mortgage payments; amortization of interest accrued

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide that, upon the expiration of the foreclosure moratorium period with
			 respect to an eligible mortgage—

text.#text: The

the term of the mortgage, and the responsibility of the mortgagor to make payments of principal and
			 interest due under the mortgage, shall resume; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be amortized, and payable, over
			 the remaining term of the mortgage.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b/p:1/sp:C

text.#text: any interest accrued pursuant to
An eligible mortgage under this subsection is a mortgage that—
is owned, held, securitized, or guaranteed by the
is a mortgage on a 1- to 4-family residence that is the principal residence of the mortgagor;

was current with respect to payments of principal and interest, and any taxes, insurance, and other
			 amounts required to be paid in escrow, that were due under the mortgage as
			 of the beginning of the foreclosure moratorium period with respect to such
			 eligible mortgage; and
has a mortgagor who—

received extended compensation or additional compensation for a week of unemployment ending at any
			 time during the 7-day period ending January 1, 2014;

has exhausted all rights to regular compensation under the unemployment compensation law of a State
			 at any time during the period beginning January 1, 2014, and ending on the
			 date of enactment of this Act and has remained continuously unemployed
			 throughout such period; or

exhausts all rights to regular compensation under the unemployment compensation law of a State at
			 any time during the period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act
			 and ending on July 1, 2014; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish, that was greater than 40
			 percent.

text.#text:
as of the beginning of the foreclosure moratorium period with respect to such eligible mortgage,
			 has a ratio of debt to income, as determined in accordance with such

The foreclosure moratorium period under this subsection with respect to an eligible mortgage shall
			 be the 6-month period beginning upon—

text.#text: in the case of an eligible mortgage of a mortgagor described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the date on which such mortgagor exhausts all rights to regular
			 compensation under the unemployment compensation law of a State.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Foreclosures Due to Congressional Dysfunction Act of 2014/s:2/ss:c/p:4/sp:A/cl:iii
